item.title: Evolution of Cooperation
item.description: I began graduate school in the summer of 2014 You can find more information about the article, including links to code, pdf, and the co-author’s website on the publication page. Please pardon our mess. This page is still a work in progress. I have many projects that I am documenting simultaneously and am doing my best to be thorough and embed a lot of rich metadata so that you can click around based on what you find interesting.

item.title: Subsurface Contaminant Transport
item.description: Overview I went to work with Dr. Velimir Vesselinov in the summer of 2017 at the Los Alamos National Laboratory (LANL). This experience drastically changed the direction of my research. I spent much of my time reading papers on Bayesian Inverse Problems and Subsurface Contaminant Transport Problems. Part of what I did was learn the Julia programming language1, implementing some Markov chain Monte Carlo methods to practice, and converting some algorithms from Python to Julia.
